result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Aldaco Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees.  Due on or before 6/8/2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

_______________________________________
Absolute sobriety.  AODA assessment and treatment. Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
No possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department and/or agent.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, school, work search, work crew, and treatment.

Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future 941.29 Wisconsin stats makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it it's own 10 year period to imprisonment or a $25,000.00 fine, or both.  Possess weapons as a convicted felon 973.176(1).
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Aldaco Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jose Aldaco Jr
Current: 949 N. 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233-1422 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2016)
Prior: 2411 W. Becher Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
electronically forwarded to DOC, because DOC was referenced in sentence.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction / DAY REPORTING CENTER, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for O days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply work, school, work search, work crew, and treatment.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
* Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees due on or before 06-08-2017. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  No possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wisconsin Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearms, carrying with it its own 10 year period fo imprisonment of a $25,000 fine or both. Possess 
Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  6 MONTHS suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice or Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Jose Aldaco in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Jose Aldaco in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
Received and Filed, letter from the defendant.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Jose Aldaco not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense will reserve the bail review for the next court date. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/8/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Jose Aldaco in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Jose Aldaco in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jose Aldaco in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jose Aldaco in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
